name: Hampshire Hotel - Crown Eindhoven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked directly with the hotel website and asked for a quiet room. As we arrived by train in the morning, we walked the 150m across to the hotel and asked to leave our bags at the hotel until we could check in later in the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: the Eden Crown is good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is not the prettiest hotel from the outside being a typical concrete monstrosity but the inside is clean and airy. Our room was at the back of the hotel at the end of the corridor, so it probable was the quietest available. The room was perfectly acceptable - twin beds pushed together rather than a double but OK. The room was clean, the bathroom was modern and the only fault was the lack of tea making facilities.
reviews.title: not worth 4 stars

reviews.text: The breakfast room is on the first floor overlooking the main street. There is a glass wall the length of the restaurant which makes for an interesting view over breakfast. The breakfast (included in our rate) included cereal, fruit and yoghurt (the fruit was fresh rather than out of a tin) cold meat and cheese. The hot items included eggs, sausages and bacon (the bacon was not brilliant) but overall a very good spread.
reviews.title: Hospitality and Location as promised

reviews.text: Given the distinct lack of other hotels in quiet locations in eindhoven, I would recommend this hotel for travellers that prefer to sleep at night than be kept awake by late night revellers!
reviews.title: Central location, good breakfast view

reviews.text: The only good point about this hotel is that it is centrally located. I have tasted better breakfast at the Ibis - burnt bacon is not my favourite thing. Staff are indifferent and when asked anything, the answer is "I don't know". Rooms are ok, although unlike other 3/4 star holidays, they do not supply you with face fannels, nor do they change the sheets during your stay. Housekeeping also seem to think it is not their duty to clean the coffee table - all the dirty glasses from the bar were still there when we got back. Do yourself a favour and stay at the holiday inn. It may be bit further out, but it is still walkable and the staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. I have stayed there before but unfortunately it was fully booked this time. Wouldn't recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Retro metro

likes.disliked: — Terrible mattresses- after a long flight your back needs a rest!

reviews.text: I stayed here while attending a conference in Eindhoven. Although it claims to be 4 star, I have been in 2 star hotels that are better equipped. The room was acceptable although, like the rest of the hotel, the decor and facilities were a bit tired. The public lounge at the hotel entrance is tiny and uncomfortable, which is quite unfortunate since this, and the restaurant, are the only places with wifi. I ate dinner here with colleagues. The food fine, but we had to wait over an hour for it to arrive. The breakfast was average but wildly expensive.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was given a surprise weekend in Eindhoven by my husband for my 40th birthday. I'd lived there as a child and had longed to revisit the Efteling so we were in the perfect city for that. The Eden Crown Hotel was fabulous, the room was spacious and adequate, nice bathrooms, ample toiletries provided. The restaurant and food were first class and the staff extremely helpful.
reviews.title: A 40th birthday present to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that a kettle and tea making facilities are not automatically provided, they must be requested and that is not made clear during booking or on arrival. This means that after the restaurant and bar close you have no options for a cup of tea or coffee and we were taken by surprise at how early they closed. By the time we realised we were too late to request a kettle and the staff were not prepared to make us a cup of tea. My husband ended up going out to McDonald's to bring me a cup back after an extremely long day at The Efteling. I'd possibly also suggest their cleaning teams vacuum the bathroom ceilings as thick dust could be observed above the slatted effect ceiling which I assume doubles as extraction when the bathroom is in use.
reviews.title: Dramatic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite this I would definitely stay again, just remember, if you book, to request a kettle!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel Great Value

reviews.text: The room we booked (executive room so not a standard one) was small, dated and very noicy. Not only from the hallway, nextdoor but most of all from the streets. Since it's located in a nightclub/bar area, people were shouting until 5 in the morning! Also, parking is not so convenient (parking in paid parking couple of blocks away). Only positive thing was the breakfast (looks, service and food).
reviews.title: Room ok, rip off breakfast

reviews.text: Not worthy of 4 stars - more like a 2 star. Parking is horrible, have to walk two blocks and enter the parking via the car entry ramp in the mornings which is also dangerous. New restaurant following remodeling is very disappointing - very "plastic" with no atmosphere whatsoever and very limited menu - you will want to dine elsewhere. Virtually no place to sit in lobby except for two or three uncomfortable chairs. The old bar was much better and the breakfast on the 2nd floor prior to remodeling was much better than now. Only advantage to this hotel (which has very small rooms) is close proximity to central Eindhoven and rail station. I have previously stayed at the Crown approximately 15 times but never again - very disappointing experience. Holiday Inn nearby (also now owned by Eden chain) has bigger rooms and better car parking. Internet is free in so-called lobby but 15 Euro in rooms. This hotel is not a good choice for business travelers.
reviews.title: Hugely disappointing

reviews.text: We stayed at the Eden Crown for 2 nights, very nice hotel, staff very friendly and polite.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel (Bargain)

likes.disliked: — No drinking facilities in room for a 4* Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel a stones throw from Eindhoven Central station which was a bonus and approximately 15 minutes drive from the airport.
reviews.title: Great location, so-so room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, American style buffet.
reviews.title: Location close to station/university/town centre

reviews.text: Overall, I recommend this hotel for a weekend break or short stay, price very reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel in a central location

likes.disliked: — Breakfast was disorganised and the girl on the bar downstairs could have been a bit friendlier!

reviews.text: Clean rooms, nice bathrooms. Decor slightly dated but spotless nonetheless. No problems at all with my booking and it was made very clear when I booked and arrived that breakfast was extra. Face it - not everyone wants breakfast! The staff were very frinedly and the service attentive without being creepy. The location is very central so no problems with getting out to eat - it's on your doorstep.
reviews.title: No problems at all
Out of pocket and out of patience
reviews.text: Things started badly from check-in at the Crown. We had booked 2 double rooms for ourselves and our friends only to be told when we arrived that doubles were unavailable and we would have to have twin rooms. On going up to the rooms we discovered that they were extremely small and pokey (it would seem there is a limited availability of the large, spacious rooms shown in the pictures) and that we had a charming view of a concrete wall. Having to suffer the indignity of pushing the beds together was bad enough, but not helped by the cleaners insisting on putting them back to there original positions each day of our stay. The general decor of the hotel was adequate and the location was convenient for the train station so we passed the rest of our stay without too much event. It was only on coming to pay the bill that the real upset came. We had been told categorically on arrival that breakfast was included in the room price and so dutifully had eaten in the hotel restaurant, even though we had friends with whom we would otherwise have dined. The bill however had the additional cost of breakfast added. This just added insult to injury after what had been barely an adequate stay in an average hotel. In spite of the hotel admitting that the mistake was theirs, they still refused to waive the additional charge and we were forced to pay due to the unfortunate position of having a flight to catch. Several e-mails with the hotel manager later and still no joy, other than offering us a single compimentary breakfast should we stay at the hotel again!!

reviews.title: Average hotel...
reviews.text: As if we'd stay again - there were 4 of us and they didn't even have the decency to offer breakfast for all of us!!

reviews.title: Excellent centrally located hotel
reviews.text: Dreadful hotel, dreadful manager, very poor customer service and bad manners to boot!

description: Certified with the Silver Green Key.
